div.p: A345, Royal Park Zoological Society letter and minute book, pp. 130-1, Mitchell Library, State Library of New South Wales, Sydney.

I have the honor to inform you that Mr B. Smyth and I inspected inspected
word repeated in copying letter into Minutes.
the S. W. angle of the Royal Park on the 21st inst. and in accordance with the request contained in your letter of the 22nd ult.
See M to A. Purchas and to R. Smyth, 22 March 1864. I now beg to hand you the following report upon the same for the consideration of the Trustees.

The road leading from Brunswick is in a bad state of repair in several portions, especially after you descend from the crown of the hill and a deep gully is forming on the upper side which if not attended to will soon render that portion dangerous.
The gates are in a very dilapidated state and a new one is required at once.

Mr Smyth suggested that plantations be formed on both sides of the entrance and as this agrees exactly with my original design for ornamenting this portion of the Park I have much pleasure in recommending it to the Notice of the Trustees and it would considerably increase the beauty of the locality.
I estimate the cost of these works as follows viz.

The meeting resolved 'to transmit this document to the A[cclimatization] Society as deserving the Council's consideration and the hon. Secret. was at the same time instructed to point out that the work concerning rough channelling, the repairs to the road & old fence and the new gate deserved precedence to that of the new fence.'
